snippet: At Urban Scholars Community School, part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s $400 million renewal program, small gains are seen, but the problems children face are unchanged.
abstract: Urban Scholars Community School in South Bronx, one of New York City's more impoverished and under-performing public schools, has received boost from Mayor Bill de Blasio's three-year, $400 million School Renewal Program, but still faces steep challenges; it remains to be seen whether school will be able to achieve significant positive change.
lead_paragraph: At Urban Scholars Community School, part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s $400 million renewal program, small gains are seen, but the problems children face are unchanged.

headline.main: Hoping, and Waiting, for a Bronx School’s Fresh Start to Pay Off
headline.print_headline: Hoping, and Waiting, for a Fresh Start to Pay Off at a South Bronx School
